content:
That's very kind of you! I'd love to get your help in crafting a follow-up email to the investor. A template or guidance on structuring the email would be super helpful.

To give you some context, I've already sent an initial email to the investor after the pitch event, and I'm looking to follow up with a more personalized email that shows I've done my research and am genuinely interested in exploring the opportunity to work together.

Here's a rough outline of what I'm thinking:

* Introduction: Briefly reintroduce myself and SmartFit, and mention our previous interaction at the pitch event.
* Research and interest: Show that I've done my research on the investor and their firm, and express my interest in exploring how SmartFit aligns with their investment thesis.
* Questions: Ask the investor about their investment criteria, what they're looking for in a startup, and any other questions that can help me better understand their thought process.
* Update on SmartFit: Provide a brief update on our progress since the pitch event, including any notable milestones or achievements.
* Next steps: Express my enthusiasm for the opportunity to work together and propose a call or meeting to discuss further.

Please feel free to suggest a template or provide guidance on how to structure the email. I'm open to any feedback or suggestions you may have!
